pathAssistantSteps.info:
• 'Contract' indicates that the proposal has been accepted and is progressing to a formal contract. The Contracts Lifecycle Management System (CLMS) is used to manage the contract process.
  • Under the ‘Contract’ tab, record the ‘CLMS Contract ID’ and update the ‘Contract Status’ field to record the contract outcome. Update the ‘Stage' field under the ‘Stage Management’ section to ‘Executed’ to record when the contract has been executed
• ‘Discontinued’ indicates that the opportunity has been lost. The ‘Loss Reason’ and ‘Loss Reason Explanation’ fields provide reasoning for the loss.
• ‘Executed’ indicates that the Contract has been executed and is in effect

• ‘Identify’ indicates that you have identified a new opportunity with a potential partner.
  • Complete the ‘Opportunity Summary’ section under the ‘Details’ tab by updating the Description’ and other datafields. Other fields are pre-populated; however, may be updated.
  • Use ‘Notes’ to record relevant information to help you manage the relationship and/or opportunity. Use the ‘Activity’ panel to record your interactions and track tasks.
  • The ‘Relationships’ tab allows you to record who is involved in progressing this opportunity

• ‘Negotiate’ indicates that you are progressing negotiations with the potential partner.
  • Complete the ‘Negotiation Checklist' section under the ‘Negotiate’ tab to confirm negotiation outcomes and readiness to proceed.
• Proposal indicants opportunity is ready for proposal submission. Use the ‘Proposal Outcome’ and ‘Proposal Outcome Comments’ fields under the ‘Submitted' tab to record the proposal outcome.
